intro: Aporosa griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan laurel, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Aporosa griffithii is often found in moist, shaded areas at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters.
